author: Special Correspondent
text:
Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Monday announced that the State will bear 3 per cent of the interest to be paid by the flood-affected small and medium enterprises who have taken loans from bank.

“I have asked the banks to provide an interest subsidy of 3 per cent on these loans. This 3 per cent will be borne by the State government,” she said in a statement. This subsidy will be provided for a period of one year and will cost the exchequer Rs. 15 crore, she said.

TNEB will fix electricity meters that were affected during the floods and electricity charges would not be levied during the period, she said.
title: State to bear 3% of interest for SMEs
